description: a(0) = 3; for n > 0, a(n) is the greatest prime factor of PreviousPrime(a(n-1))*a(n-1)-1 where PreviousPrime(prime(k))=prime(k-1).
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: To get a(3) we compute PreviousPrime(7)=5, 5*7-1=34, greatest prime factor of 34 is 17, so a(3)=17.
mathematica: a[0] = 3; a[n_] := a[n] = FactorInteger[ NextPrime[ a[n-1], -1]*a[n-1] - 1][[-1, 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 66}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 09 2012 *)NestList[FactorInteger[NextPrime[#,-1]*#-1][[-1,1]]&,3,70] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 13 2012 *)
author: _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_
